input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Ability to speak english has a direct effect on the forest. The smoker has a direct effect on the forest. Method 1: We look directly at how ability to speak english correlates with the forest in general. Method 2: We look at this correlation case by case according to the smoker. To understand how ability to speak english affects the forest, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
